item.title: About
item.description: I am a MSc of joined Computer Science and Math. I enjoy libre software. Living in Wrocław, Poland. Come see this beautiful city and have a beer with me! Security bugs portfolio CVE-2023-2234 (RCE in Zephyr BT HCI) CVE-2024-34083 (NOSTARTTLS in aiosmtpd) Nerd Stuff The posts on this blog are licensed under the Creative Commons BY-SA 4.0 license. I built this blog using Hugo, markdown, PaperMod, and GitLab Pages. You can take a look at the source if you’re curious as to how it works.

item.title: Contact
item.description: The best way to contact me is to send me an email: blog at arusekk.pl. I reply after a week at most. If it does not work, try arek_koz at o2.pl. You can find me also on Matrix (@Arusekk:matrix.org) and Discord (@Arusekk#6609). I sometimes lag more on those, but if you are lucky and catch me online, we can talk with the least ping.

item.title: Blogroll
item.description: I love the idea of personal blogging. If you know any search engine that only includes genuine blogs by actual people and excludes all the new-age auto-generated content, advertisements, social media posts and low-effort journalists, please let me know. Here is a blogroll of my friends (if you feel left out, reach out!): Franciszek Malinka (feed) Disconnect3d (feed) BonusPlay Radosław Miernik (feed) … and some other blogs I found nice:

item.title: Tech vs religion
item.description: It is 2023 already, and religion, to the dismay of many, still holds on tight.

item.title: Rant on TLS PKI
item.description: There are some fundamental design flaws in X.509 / WebPKI (HTTPS/TLS key infrasructure), and I am freaked out nobody has noticed. Or have they?

item.title: Die, IPv4, just die already!!!1!
item.description: IPv4 is obsolete and has no future. Just deal with it. IPv6 is the way to go.
